properties.description:
The Keystone Mapping Project

The Keystone Mapping Project (KMP) is the most comprehensive public resource for detailed route information on the proposed Keystone XL Pipeline. The pipeline stretches over 2,000 miles from Hardisty, Alberta to Port Arthur, Texas. As neither TransCanada Corporation nor the U.S. Department of State (DOS) have been forthcoming with this project's GIS information, it is impossible to adequately evaluate the potential environmental impacts of the pipeline. These maps here have been compiled from alternative public resources. On the KMP website one will find a discussion of the issues surrounding the Keystone XL route, additional maps, and image galleries.

  • More information: KMP Website »»
  • Stay Informed: KMP on Facebook »»

Additional Maps:

To view detail, zoom using the Navigation Tool on the right:

  • Keystone XL Oil Spill Voluntary Evacuation Zone (232 kb) »»
  • Nebraska DEQ KXL Detail 9.5.12 (274 kb) »»
  • Principal Aquifers, US Lower 48 (7.7 MB) »»

Usage Notes

  • Use the Navigation Tool on the right to zoom and pan.
  • Activate the Sidebar (View Menu > Sidebar). In the Places panel, turn layers on and off, or click on them to travel directly to landmarks.
  • Use the Search panel to determine your location in relation to the pipeline.

These files are for personal use only. Distribution and posting to the Internet is not permitted without written permission. All site contents ©Thomas Bachand 2012.

properties.name: MP MT DEQ
properties.description:
Keystone XL
Montana Centerline Milepost Markers

Source: US Fish and Wildlife Service. August 2012.
Interval: 1 mile
Note: Pipeline construction will occur within a 500' corridor. MDEQ evaluation based on Feb 2012 corridor. For waterbody crossings, cross-check MP markers against Waterbody Crossing table found in 2014 FSEIS.
View: Zoom [+] to ground level in this KMP Google Earth view.

More Maps & Detail: Keystone Mapping Project
